*ghostblade OP for one patch*

mage mains cry "riot has an AD bias!!!"

l u l desu

Mage mains complain about AD having more AD + MR items compared to AP + Armor.

AD mains respond by qqing about Zhonyas. It works both ways (and Zhonyas isn't even that good right now)
prolly cos mages have range + aoe burst + CC but you know that's just me hehe xd
cause {{champion:126}} {{champion:110}} don't have those as well right?

I can deal with those, but you know what really grinds my gears?

When a goddamn assassin jumps on me and is literally unpeelable thanks to Edge of Night.

Sure, it's possible. But when you get into the situation of "hit a spell and THEN hit your CC, otherwise you die" You know something is wrong.

If my only counterplay to an assassin who can 100/0 me with 2-3 spells and AAs has a timeframe of less than a second I will call it broken.

-------

And I'll also call Hexdrinker broken. It's literally the AD counterpart to Zhonyas. The difference? You have to stack Seekers Armguards while Hexdrinker gets the passive for free.

AD mains: We cant build 1000 AD unlike mages being able to build 1000 AP.

Mage mains: We cant crit and we have cooldowns though.

Ad mains: 1 second cooldowns.
You forgot 5000 range
Not to mention a {{item:3100}} makes you do 500 ap damage to towers per auto with 1k ap built.
Ahri is actually quite fine lol Does anyone remember when she used to do extra damage to a charmed enemy? lol
Yes, and that was only  a problem when DFG was still in the game.
nerf {{champion:103}} but pls, don't hurt my other mages, {{item:3165}} is always a decent item and with {{item:3157}} nerf during the MYMU and the recent {{item:3116}} everyone else will suffer

Morello's deserves it.

Its overly efficient and has GW tacked onto it for no reason, along with having the most forgiving build-path in the game.
______________
Maybe 5 of the champs that were using Rylai's needed it; the rest had no business building it, which is exactly why it got nerfed. You can't use it as an example of classic mage itemization getting nerfed. 
_____________
Zhonya's deserved its nerf as well, but the active's CD might be a little too high right now.

Rylais could use an HP boost so that bruiser mages can feel good about it, right now it just sucks ass in general. Keep its AP the same.

I agree that the HP was probably hit too hard; the slow as well for Single Target spells. It shouldn't be a DoT champion item; that's where lots off issues started in the first place.

However, the biggest issue by far was the AP, and yet that's what got the smallest hit.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vZYpFobJ,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-09T03:15:38.474+0000)

> 
> However, the biggest issue by far was the AP, and yet that's what got the smallest hit.

It got a pretty decent hit along with the utility. I see no reason why rylais shouldn't at least get 100 hp back, if not maybe even 150.

TBH, I'd rather shave another 5 AP off it, give it 200 HP, make the single target not suck (problematic abilities have been considered AoE or DoT if they're too strong with it before), and up the cost a bit to balance it out.

Ahri could always use nerfs, yeah.

But she won't get them, because "some champions are balance when they have super high win and play rates" lol. The waifuest of excuses possible.

I still don't think she needs nerfed, I think she needs a rework reversion. The extraneous mobility Riot added to her Q for no good reason needs to go.  Since they stripped the Charm amp and gave this unnecessary movement speed, she's been too strong in addition to being frustrating to play against - just revert the rework and return skill-based lane interactions instead of mindless spamming and running around like an idiot avoiding everything.
I remember how long it took them to nerf IBG and sunfire ahh good times
